intro: Pimpinella stracheyi, commonly known as the strachey's cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a feathery appearance, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Pimpinella stracheyi is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
